p: In our overall sample of children aged 15 days to 2 years, the average age of infants was 4.6 months, and 90% of them were younger than 12 months. RSV was responsible for respiratory infection in 47.9% of children. This rate is comparable to what has already been reported in other studies using the same method for detecting viruses by real-time PCR, with rates described as ranging from 44% to 49% [7], [11], [14], [19]. Even higher RSV positivity rates of about 50% have been reported [19]. This nonsegmented RNA virus of the family Paramyxoviridae is one of the main virus agents responsible for paediatric respiratory infections in the world [20] and is also the primary cause of paediatric hospitalization.
